container.heading: Maryland Foreign Discriminatory Boycotts Act Regulations
container.text: The Maryland Foreign Discriminatory Boycotts Act has been preempted by the federal Export Administration Act of 1979, as amended, 50 U.S.C. App. §2407, and is, therefore, not currently enforceable. By Executive Order 12730 (September 30, 1990) the President of the United States continued the application of the Export Administration Act of 1979 until terminated. Consequently, the regulations promulgated under Maryland law will not be printed in the Code of Maryland Regulations at this time. The Maryland law and regulations will become effective only if Executive Order 12730 is terminated.

annotations.annotation: Commercial Law Article, §§11-101—11-115, Annotated Code of Maryland
